{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524517,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T05:54:23.281Z","cooked":"

In pyfrc 2025.1.0 I’ve added a new ‘isolated’ mode for running the robot tests. Instead of trying to reset the python process and wpilib before each test, each individual test is ran in a new python process. I hope that this will eliminate a variety of issues that teams have run into when running the robot tests.

There are two ways to enable this in your robot tests. You can run your tests via robotpy test --isolated, or (preferred) you can add the following to pyproject.toml:

[tool.robotpy.pyfrc]
isolated = true

Please try this out and let me know how it goes. I expect to make this the only available test mode next year, assuming no major issues are discovered.

Currently dealing with out of disk space on a RIO1 while trying to deploy with pip.

I suspect the problem is us, using a RIO1

But as soon as that is clear, this is on our list of things to try.

Appreciate it!!

Hm, you shouldn’t really be running out of space unless you’re doing something like logging data to the rio’s flash… or maybe the deploy program is copying a virtualenv into the rio?

Nah, this is during the pip installs before the program is copied over, and I already deleted the old user program from the py folder manually.

What I haven’t triaged is where the disk space is actually getting used … And if there’s just some massive file.

This post flagged as “off topic”

I’ll see if I can track down a repeatable example for you.

Here we go! Our current code is doing the failure thing in isolated mode. Error message doesn’t really clue me in to what’s happening.

GitHub

Release isolated-test-failure · TheTriSonics/Reefscape2025

Wth this code tests fail in --isolated mode but pass under the old me…

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-19T13:51:16.224Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":8,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":55,"readers_count":54,"score":26.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491330,"topic_slug":"please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode","display_username":"Justin Buist","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/TheTriSonics/Reefscape2025/releases/tag/isolated-test-failure","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Release isolated-test-failure · TheTriSonics/Reefscape2025 · GitHub","clicks":3}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24678,"username":"Justin_Buist","name":"Justin Buist","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24678,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode/491330/9","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3533825,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-20T02:36:07.547Z","cooked":"

Ah yes, you copied 4774’s repo. The problem is the get_alliance_stations function in the fuzz tests returns a random alliance… and when we launch the new process, it’s random again. There’s probably a clever way to detect and fix it, but this is really niche so it’s probably not worth spending the time to figure out how to handle it in pyfrc.

Here’s an awful workaround:

def get_alliance_stations() -> list[str]:
    import json
    cached = os.environ.get("ALLIANCE_CACHE", None)
    if cached:
        return json.loads(cached)

    stations = (1, 2, 3)
    if "CI" in os.environ:  # pragma: no branch
        choices = [
            f"{alliance}{station}"
            for alliance in ("Blue", "Red")
            for station in stations
        ]
    else:  # pragma: no cover
        choices = [f"Blue{random.choice(stations)}", f"Red{random.choice(stations)}"]

    os.environ["ALLIANCE_CACHE"] = json.dumps(choices)
    return choices
","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-20T02:36:07.547Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":64.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491330,"topic_slug":"please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24678,"username":"Justin_Buist","name":"Justin Buist","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode/491330/10","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3535289,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/8072_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T15:26:05.448Z","cooked":"

por fin

image1132×268 11.1 KB

Fixes our issues, and we were able to remove our destroyAllSingletonInstances() hack

Overall the test runs slower (the first 8 technically don’t need HAL isolation). But I like slow working tests over borked and fast.

Appreciate the hard work and ingenuity yet again!

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-21T15:29:08.663Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":33,"readers_count":32,"score":11.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":491330,"topic_slug":"please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode","display_username":"Chris Gerth","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/RobotCasserole1736/RobotCasserole2025/tree/chris_test_multiunittest","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"GitHub - RobotCasserole1736/RobotCasserole2025 at chris_test_multiunittest","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24617,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode/491330/11","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3535399,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T16:52:47.808Z","cooked":"

In theory we could run the tests in parallel like pytest-xdist does, which could speed things up. We should also be able to detect when the robot fixture isn’t being used and not isolate those tests.

  • Isolated mode: only isolate tests that use the robot fixture · Issue #240 · robotpy/pyfrc · GitHub
  • Isolated mode: run tests in parallel · Issue #241 · robotpy/pyfrc · GitHub
","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":14,"updated_at":"2025-02-21T16:52:47.808Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":11,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":31,"readers_count":30,"score":11.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":491330,"topic_slug":"please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/pyfrc/issues/241","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Isolated mode: run tests in parallel · Issue #241 · robotpy/pyfrc · GitHub","clicks":0},{"url":"https://github.com/robotpy/pyfrc/issues/240","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Isolated mode: only isolate tests that use the robot fixture · Issue #240 · robotpy/pyfrc · GitHub","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24617,"username":"gerthworm","name":"Chris Gerth","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/8072_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/please-try-pyfrcs-new-isolated-test-mode/491330/12","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3535453,"name":"Chris Gerth","username":"gerthworm","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/gerthworm/{size}/8072_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-21T17:49:03.080Z","cooked":"
virtuald:

Isolated mode: run tests in parallel · Issue 241 · robotpy/pyfrc · GitHub

Possibly!

There’s a chance you get some cross-talk on things that open ports on localhost - photonvision’s ntp-at-home, NT, our team’s insane love for web dashboards at home…

But still all a net improvement.

My team uses custom fixtures which are imported in a conftest.py file located at the root of our repo. It always worked great with robotpy testing, but in isolated mode, it looks like our file “overwrites” robotpy’s fixtures (i.e. the fixture robot cannot be found). When I remove the conftest.py file, I am able to run a few tests that do no require our own fixtures.
